Module kivakit.core.commandline
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.commandline

Class CommandLineParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telenav.kivakit.core.commandline.CommandLineParser
  • public class CommandLineParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Parses an array of command line arguments into a list of SwitchList of the form "-switch=value" and a list of remaining non-switch arguments in an ArgumentList. Normally, this class does not need to be used directly, as the Application base class provides easier access to the same functionality.

    Parsing a Command Line

    Parsers for individual switches and arguments can be added with add(SwitchParser) and add(ArgumentParser), respectively. The command line may then be parsed with parse(String[]), taking the array of arguments passed to the program's main(String[] arguments) method and returning a CommandLine object representing the parsed command line.

    Switch Conventions

    Please note that the common UNIX convention of having switches with no value, "-verbose" for example, is not supported. All switches must be specified with a value, such as "-verbose=true". Also note that the UNIX convention of binding switches to the next argument (without using "=") is not supported either (so, "-output myfile.txt" must be specified as "-output=myfile.txt").

    Example

    There are many classes in KivaKit that provide switch and argument parsers and it is easy to build new ones. Parsers for some commonly used types are available as static methods in ArgumentParser and SwitchParser. Here they are used to create a small example. This application takes one or more integer arguments. If the switch -multiplier=[number] is passed in, each argument is multiplied by the multiplier before the arguments are summed to produce a result: 

         private static final ArgumentParser<Integer> NUMBER = ArgumentParser
         .integerArgument("numbers to add")
         .oneOrMore()
         .build();

     private static final SwitchParser<Integer> MULTIPLIER = SwitchParser
         .integerSwitch("multiplier", "multiplier for each number")
         .optional()
         .defaultValue(1)
         .build();

     public static void main(final String[] arguments)
     {
         new Example(new CommandLineParser()
             .add(NUMBER)
             .add(MULTIPLIER)
             .parse(arguments);
     }

     public Example(final CommandLine commandLine)
     {
         final int multiplier = commandLine.get(MULTIPLIER);
         var result = 0;
         for (final Argument argument : commandLine)
         {
             result += argument.get(NUMBER) * multiplier;
         }
         LOGGER.information("result = $", result);
     }
    Author:
    jonathanl (shibo)
    See Also:
    SwitchParser, ArgumentParser, CommandLine

        Parameters:
